name: Bacon Wrapped Barbeque Shrimp
author: Jan
summary: These are spicy and wonderful! As close as I can get to a restaurant version that I am addicted to. Serves 2 as an entree and 4 as an appetizer.
directions: Wrap shrimp with 1/2 slice of bacon, securing with a toothpick
Be sure and use the large shrimp--the cooking time for the shrimp and the bacon is similar
If you use medium-sized shrimp, you might want to precook the bacon a little--over cooked shrimp are tough and rubbery--and a real shame
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Line a jelly roll pan with extra heavy duty foil, and place baking rack in the pan
Place the shrimp on the rack, and sprinkle heavily with the barbecue seasoning
The bacon will turn from creamy white to a little opaque, and the seasonings will soak in
Bake in the preheated oven until bacon is crisp and shrimp are tender, 10 to 15 minutes
The rack keeps the shrimp from sitting in the draining bacon fat
With a little luck, you won't tear the foil--you can throw that away and only have to scrub the rack
